alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Marshall; Maury; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:20PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall, southwestern Rutherford, northeastern Maury, southeastern Williamson and northwestern Bedford Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spring Hill, or 10 miles south of Franklin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Smyrna, Brentwood, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Thompson`s Station, Eagleville, Rover, Rockvale and Triune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 49 and 67. Interstate 24 between mile markers 68 and 71. Interstate 840 between mile markers 26 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
